page.title: 20Caldecote Farm
page.content: When we arrived at Caldecote Farm my first feeling was disappointment because it was not a farm at all. It was a riding stable. Not a stable that gave lessons but somswhere for horses to stay on either half or full livery. Full livery costs fourteen pounds per week and for that the grooms feed,exercise,and clean the ponies. At the moment there are forty nine ponies there so the grooms are very busy. They have indoor training rings,exercise paddocks and a jumping ring for the ponies who are in competitions. The owner is called Roger and he lives in an old converted dairy. He has to get up at 6 am. to get through the hectic routine. I thought the horses were well looked after and if I had a horse I would put him there.
